title: Count Word Occurrences
description: Count how many times each word appears in a string
instructions:
Write a function `wordCount(str)` that takes a string and returns an object where keys are words and values are the number of times each word appears. Convert everything to lowercase.

Example: wordCount('hello world hello') should return { hello: 2, world: 1 }

hints.content: Use an object to store word counts. For each word, either increment its count if it exists, or set it to 1 if it's new.
Split the string into words and create an empty object. Loop through words and check if each word already exists in the object. If yes, increment its value; if no, set it to 1.
Use `const words = str.toLowerCase().split(' ');` and `const counts = {};`. Loop and check: `if (counts[words[i]])` then `counts[words[i]]++` else `counts[words[i]] = 1`.

testCases.input: a b a c b a

learningObjectives: Using objects to store key-value pairs
